data.title: A World of Ideas; 230; Toni Morrison Part 2 of 2
data.meta_description:
Bill Moyers conversation with the writer Toni Morrison continues. They
discuss the silence of the Black voice in 19th century literature to the
lingering presence of racism in the publishing world today. Morrison is the
author of several novels including SONG OF SOLOMON and the Pulitzer
Prize-winning BELOVED. Part 2 of 2.
A WORLD OF IDEAS with Bill Moyers aired in 1988 and 1990. The half-hour
episodes featured scientists, writers, artists, philosophers, historians --
some well-known, many never before seen on television.
